metadata.name: Global Tariff Briefing
metadata.audience: NYT colleagues tracking tariffs and trade policy globally

all.headline: Indian IT Stocks Slide to 30-Month Low as Citrini Flags AI Risks
all.description: A rout in Indian software services stocks deepened, tracking a US tech selloff, after a report from Citrini Research amplified concerns about companies vulnerable to the growing influence of artificia

all.headline: Arini’s Lemssouguer Says AI Fear Risks Software Defaults
all.description: Fear of AI’s potential for disruption is enough to push up borrowing costs for software companies, causing problems for a sector that has a lot of debt, according to Arini Capital Management’s founder

all.headline: US Can Sell More T-Bills to Offset Lost Tariff Revenue, BNY Says
all.description: The US is likely to issue more short-dated notes to make up for lost revenues after the Supreme Court overturned President Donald Trump’s tariffs, according to a BNY strategist.

all.headline: Fire, Power Outage Disrupt Operations at Cape Town Airport
all.description: A fire and a power outage disrupted operations at Cape Town International Airport on Tuesday, leading to delays at the gateway to South Africa’s main tourism hub.

all.headline: Old-Economy Stocks Are Looking Pretty Good Right About Now
all.description: A basket of capital-intensive stocks is rallying as investors flee AI disruption.

all.headline: Tata Defers Vote on Chairman’s New Term, Signaling Power Tussle
all.description: The board of Tata Sons Pvt. deferred a decision on granting a third term to Chairman Natarajan Chandrasekaran, people familiar said, in the latest sign that another leadership tussle could be brewing

all.headline: America’s Ube Obsession Is Straining Supplies
all.description: Ube has officially gone viral. Purple lattes, cheesecakes and pancakes are increasingly cropping up on dessert menus, but as a result, supplies are tightening. Ilena Peng has more. (Source: Bloomberg)

all.headline: Meat Snack Maker Archer Gets $100 Million Loan as Demand From Women Grows
all.description: Archer Meat Snacks secured a credit facility for nearly $100 million from JPMorgan Chase & Co., allowing it to ramp up production as demand surges for its high-protein snacks — particularly

all.headline: Exxon Touts Guyana Growth in Race For Next Decade’s Oil Fields
all.description: Exxon Mobil Corp. is betting the economic boom unleashed by its giant discovery in Guyana will give the company an edge when negotiating fiscal terms with other nations looking to develop their own oi

all.headline: Nippon Steel Upsizes Bond Sale for US Steel Loan to $3.8 Billion
all.description: Nippon Steel Corp. is seeking 600 billion yen ($3.8 billion) from an upsized sale of convertible bonds, one of the biggest Japanese offerings of its kind on record, to help repay loans taken out for i

all.headline: Trump's new tariff comes into effect at lower than expected rate
all.description: The global levy comes in at 10%, lower than the rate the president had threatened at the weekend.

all.headline: Number of workers on zero-hours contracts hits record high ahead of crackdown
all.description: There has been a 181,000 increase in the number of zero-hours contracts since Labour was elected.

all.headline: Chocolate kept in anti-theft boxes as shops warn it's being stolen to order
all.description: Retailers and police forces tell the BBC that thieves are targeting chocolate and selling it on.

all.headline: Reform vows to overhaul pension schemes for new local government workers
all.description: Reform plans to end more generous defined benefit pension schemes for new local government workers if it wins office

all.headline: Trump Organization unveils plan for 'Australia's tallest building'
all.description: The tower will be built on Queensland's Gold Coast and be 335 metres high, taller than the Shard in London.

all.headline: Orbital space race heats up in Arctic north
all.description: Europe lags far behind the US and China in orbital space launches, but new facilities are opening up.

all.headline: FedEx sues for Trump tariff refund
all.description: The US Supreme Court ruling that the US president overstepped when imposing levies paved the way for firms to seek a refund.

all.headline: No 10 says ‘nothing off the table’ over new US tariffs as UK could be among worst hit
all.description: Downing Street says discussions are ongoing following US President Donald Trump's announcement of a 15% global tariffs.

all.headline: Company director jailed over £7m airline parts fraud
all.description: The judge said the actions were a "more or less complete undermining" of rules designed to ensure passenger flights are safe.

all.headline: Netflix boss defends bid for Warner Bros as Paramount deadline looms
all.description: Ted Sarandos says his company's offer is better for industry growth as it is "buying assets we don't currently have".

all.headline: Russian soldiers tell BBC they saw fellow troops executed on commanders' orders
all.description: Four men expose the horror and brutality of conditions in the Ukraine war, with two saying they saw soldiers being shot for refusing orders.

all.headline: Mexico sends thousands of soldiers to stop violence after death of drug lord
all.description: A wave of violence has erupted across Mexico since a powerful drug cartel boss died following his capture by special forces.

all.headline: More than 5,000 flights cancelled as US east coast digs out of record snow
all.description: A major snowstorm dumps more than a foot of snow in several areas, bringing power cuts and disruption.

all.headline: French minister moves to block US envoy Kushner from government access
all.description: The minister says Charles Kushner, father of Trump's son-in-law Jared, failed to explain comments about violence in France.

all.headline: Ukraine negotiator tells BBC how it feels to sit across table from Russia
all.description: Sergiy Kyslytsya is among those trying to negotiate an end to the conflict, which is entering its fifth year.

all.headline: Robert Carradine, Lizzie McGuire and Revenge of the Nerds star, dies aged 71
all.description: His family says the actor took his own life after living with bipolar disorder for nearly two decades.

all.headline: Probe under way after illness kills 72 tigers in Thai tourist park
all.description: Authorities say samples showed the canine distemper virus, but have not confirmed where it came from.

all.headline: US partially evacuates Beirut embassy amid rising Iran tensions
all.description: The State Department has ordered non-essential staff to leave the embassy in Beirut after a security review.

all.headline: Trump threatens countries that 'play games' with existing trade deals
all.description: The threat comes after the Supreme Court ruled on Friday that Trump had exceeded his authority in enacting a sweeping global programme of tariffs.

all.headline: Moscow rail hub explosion was suicide bomb, Russian officials say
all.description: A traffic police officer and the suspect were killed in the explosion, Russian officials say.

4 years into Ukraine conflict, Zelensky says Russia’s Putin ‘did not win this war’

Hong Kong authorities probe death of scaffolding worker who fell from factory

Future of Japan’s ‘naked festival’ in doubt after 3 men left unconscious
UK announces largest sanctions package against Russia since start of full-scale invasion
all.description: Britain is targeting Russia's war economy on the fourth anniversary of Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine.

all.headline: Paris says US envoy’s no-show will ‘affect’ role
all.description: Charles Kushner has been temporarily blocked from meeting members of the French government after failing to attend a diplomatic summons.

all.headline: European Council president slams Hungary’s ‘disrespect’ over Ukraine loan
all.description: Budapest is threatening to block EU support for Ukraine.

all.headline: Trump spares EU and UK from higher tariff rates for now
all.description: Tariffs on exports to the United States will remain at 10 percent.

all.headline: Can Starmer shake off Mandelson’s ghost?
all.description: Presented by Amazon

all.headline: Merz in China und POLITICO feiert 2. Geburtstag in Berlin
all.description: PRÄSENTIERT VON ROCHE DEUTSCHLAND.

all.headline: Four years of war — and Hungary breaks EU unity
all.description: Presented by Amazon

all.headline: Swedish business leader Ehnbom proposed Epstein meet women she mentored, emails show
all.description: Barbro Ehnbom, known in Sweden for programs to boost female leadership, forwarded photos and suggested meetings.

all.headline: EU countries threaten to take Commission to court for giving Parliament extra powers
all.description: Letter shows that EU capitals are particularly annoyed about a Commission promise to ensure Council and Parliament get “equal treatment” in the legislative process.

all.headline: Putin is running his war on the Micawber Principle: Something will turn up
all.description: The Russian leader is betting on playing the long game.

primary.headline: Arini’s Lemssouguer Says AI Fear Risks Software Defaults
primary.description: Fear of AI’s potential for disruption is enough to push up borrowing costs for software companies, causing problems for a sector that has a lot of debt, according to Arini Capital Management’s founder

primary.headline: US Can Sell More T-Bills to Offset Lost Tariff Revenue, BNY Says
primary.description: The US is likely to issue more short-dated notes to make up for lost revenues after the Supreme Court overturned President Donald Trump’s tariffs, according to a BNY strategist.

primary.headline: Fire, Power Outage Disrupt Operations at Cape Town Airport
primary.description: A fire and a power outage disrupted operations at Cape Town International Airport on Tuesday, leading to delays at the gateway to South Africa’s main tourism hub.

primary.headline: Old-Economy Stocks Are Looking Pretty Good Right About Now
primary.description: A basket of capital-intensive stocks is rallying as investors flee AI disruption.

primary.headline: Tata Defers Vote on Chairman’s New Term, Signaling Power Tussle
primary.description: The board of Tata Sons Pvt. deferred a decision on granting a third term to Chairman Natarajan Chandrasekaran, people familiar said, in the latest sign that another leadership tussle could be brewing

primary.headline: America’s Ube Obsession Is Straining Supplies
primary.description: Ube has officially gone viral. Purple lattes, cheesecakes and pancakes are increasingly cropping up on dessert menus, but as a result, supplies are tightening. Ilena Peng has more. (Source: Bloomberg)

primary.headline: Meat Snack Maker Archer Gets $100 Million Loan as Demand From Women Grows
primary.description: Archer Meat Snacks secured a credit facility for nearly $100 million from JPMorgan Chase & Co., allowing it to ramp up production as demand surges for its high-protein snacks — particularly

primary.headline: Exxon Touts Guyana Growth in Race For Next Decade’s Oil Fields
primary.description: Exxon Mobil Corp. is betting the economic boom unleashed by its giant discovery in Guyana will give the company an edge when negotiating fiscal terms with other nations looking to develop their own oi

primary.headline: Nippon Steel Upsizes Bond Sale for US Steel Loan to $3.8 Billion
primary.description: Nippon Steel Corp. is seeking 600 billion yen ($3.8 billion) from an upsized sale of convertible bonds, one of the biggest Japanese offerings of its kind on record, to help repay loans taken out for i

secondary.headline: Trump's new tariff comes into effect at lower than expected rate
secondary.description: The global levy comes in at 10%, lower than the rate the president had threatened at the weekend.

secondary.headline: Number of workers on zero-hours contracts hits record high ahead of crackdown
secondary.description: There has been a 181,000 increase in the number of zero-hours contracts since Labour was elected.

secondary.headline: Chocolate kept in anti-theft boxes as shops warn it's being stolen to order
secondary.description: Retailers and police forces tell the BBC that thieves are targeting chocolate and selling it on.

secondary.headline: Reform vows to overhaul pension schemes for new local government workers
secondary.description: Reform plans to end more generous defined benefit pension schemes for new local government workers if it wins office

secondary.headline: Trump Organization unveils plan for 'Australia's tallest building'
secondary.description: The tower will be built on Queensland's Gold Coast and be 335 metres high, taller than the Shard in London.

secondary.headline: Orbital space race heats up in Arctic north
secondary.description: Europe lags far behind the US and China in orbital space launches, but new facilities are opening up.

secondary.headline: FedEx sues for Trump tariff refund
secondary.description: The US Supreme Court ruling that the US president overstepped when imposing levies paved the way for firms to seek a refund.

secondary.headline: No 10 says ‘nothing off the table’ over new US tariffs as UK could be among worst hit
secondary.description: Downing Street says discussions are ongoing following US President Donald Trump's announcement of a 15% global tariffs.

secondary.headline: Company director jailed over £7m airline parts fraud
secondary.description: The judge said the actions were a "more or less complete undermining" of rules designed to ensure passenger flights are safe.

secondary.headline: Netflix boss defends bid for Warner Bros as Paramount deadline looms
secondary.description: Ted Sarandos says his company's offer is better for industry growth as it is "buying assets we don't currently have".

secondary.headline: Russian soldiers tell BBC they saw fellow troops executed on commanders' orders
secondary.description: Four men expose the horror and brutality of conditions in the Ukraine war, with two saying they saw soldiers being shot for refusing orders.

secondary.headline: Mexico sends thousands of soldiers to stop violence after death of drug lord
secondary.description: A wave of violence has erupted across Mexico since a powerful drug cartel boss died following his capture by special forces.

secondary.headline: More than 5,000 flights cancelled as US east coast digs out of record snow
secondary.description: A major snowstorm dumps more than a foot of snow in several areas, bringing power cuts and disruption.

secondary.headline: French minister moves to block US envoy Kushner from government access
secondary.description: The minister says Charles Kushner, father of Trump's son-in-law Jared, failed to explain comments about violence in France.

secondary.headline: Ukraine negotiator tells BBC how it feels to sit across table from Russia
secondary.description: Sergiy Kyslytsya is among those trying to negotiate an end to the conflict, which is entering its fifth year.

secondary.headline: Robert Carradine, Lizzie McGuire and Revenge of the Nerds star, dies aged 71
secondary.description: His family says the actor took his own life after living with bipolar disorder for nearly two decades.

secondary.headline: Probe under way after illness kills 72 tigers in Thai tourist park
secondary.description: Authorities say samples showed the canine distemper virus, but have not confirmed where it came from.

secondary.headline: US partially evacuates Beirut embassy amid rising Iran tensions
secondary.description: The State Department has ordered non-essential staff to leave the embassy in Beirut after a security review.

secondary.headline: Trump threatens countries that 'play games' with existing trade deals
secondary.description: The threat comes after the Supreme Court ruled on Friday that Trump had exceeded his authority in enacting a sweeping global programme of tariffs.

secondary.headline: Moscow rail hub explosion was suicide bomb, Russian officials say
secondary.description: A traffic police officer and the suspect were killed in the explosion, Russian officials say.

UK announces largest sanctions package against Russia since start of full-scale invasion
secondary.description: Britain is targeting Russia's war economy on the fourth anniversary of Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine.

secondary.headline: Paris says US envoy’s no-show will ‘affect’ role
secondary.description: Charles Kushner has been temporarily blocked from meeting members of the French government after failing to attend a diplomatic summons.

secondary.headline: European Council president slams Hungary’s ‘disrespect’ over Ukraine loan
secondary.description: Budapest is threatening to block EU support for Ukraine.

secondary.headline: Trump spares EU and UK from higher tariff rates for now
secondary.description: Tariffs on exports to the United States will remain at 10 percent.

secondary.description: Presented by Amazon

secondary.headline: Swedish business leader Ehnbom proposed Epstein meet women she mentored, emails show
secondary.description: Barbro Ehnbom, known in Sweden for programs to boost female leadership, forwarded photos and suggested meetings.

secondary.headline: EU countries threaten to take Commission to court for giving Parliament extra powers
secondary.description: Letter shows that EU capitals are particularly annoyed about a Commission promise to ensure Council and Parliament get “equal treatment” in the legislative process.

secondary.headline: Putin is running his war on the Micawber Principle: Something will turn up
secondary.description: The Russian leader is betting on playing the long game.
